results.title: On stream
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: Records the building of the Shell Oil Refinery at Geelong, Victoria. Shows initial stages in the cleaning, dredging and excavating of the land; the arrival of a Dutch contracting firm for the building of the one million pound distillation plant; laying of the pipeline which will carry petroleum to Melbourne. Narrated by Mungo MacCallum.

results.title: On stage please at Hackney Empire
results.creator_credit: David E Naughton Film and Television Productions, David L. Watkins and David E. Naughton
results.brief_description: An historical account of one of Britain’s last-standing music hall theatres, the Hackney Empire. Opened in 1901 this wonderful theatre became the home for many famous British music hall artists and entertainers right up into the 1950s when it was finally closed down in 1956. However, against all odds, the music theatre has survived and this film documents the re-opening in 1989 with interviews, personal reminiscings, stills, archival footage and live performances from past and present entertainers including Bernard Bresslaw, Roy Hudd, Chas ‘n’ Dave, Helen shapiro, Frankie Vaughan, Tommy Trinder, Barbara Windsor, Larry Adler and many more. Also features the Royal Artillery Orchestra. Variety at its best.

results.title: On stage
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Ronald Dick
results.brief_description: Follows a community group in the production of a play from initial casting auditions to the final actual performance. Attempts to give, through its explanatory commentary, an overall view of typical amateur activities and a few hints on common theatrical and organisational problems.

results.title: On solder
results.brief_description: Presents the latest soldering techniques used in the electronics industry. Uses close-up photography to reveal the physical and chemical actions that occur in soldering. Shows the difference between perfect and imperfect solder points and demonstrates the detrimental effect of a poor joint on the efficiency of the electronic circuit.

results.title: On seven hills they built a city
results.brief_description: Provides without commentary a broad impression of the city of Rome. Contrasts old and new and shows the people, their pastimes, traditions, rituals, buildings, markets and transport.

results.title: On seeing film: film and literature
results.creator_credit: University of Southern California. Dept. of Cinema, Sam Spiegel Productions, Columbia Pictures, Ric Sanderson and Dustin Rawlinson
results.brief_description: Presented by William Holden, this film uses scenes from Bridge on the River Kwai to illustrate a fairly simplistic approach to character study and its development through film narrative and montage. How believable events, characters and conduct combine to make a memorable experience, whether in a book or in a film. Made from footage filmed behind the scenes in Ceylon, during the production of “The Bridge Over the River Kwai”, including scenes of David Lean directing Alec Guinness in rehearsal, and several clips from the film itself.

results.title: On screen direction
results.creator_credit: John A. Givins, Lynn John and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode examines the process of on-screen direction. It details the technical orchestration of setting up the shoot, camera position, visual sequences needed, actuality shots and the direction of people through constant communication and the defining of roles and functions for all people involved. It also explores the requirements for directing special talent including children and animals, and their special needs.

results.title: On schedule
results.creator_credit: George E. Bowen, Saga Productions, Brockhouse Steel Structures and Roy Norton
results.brief_description: An impressive demonstration of a prefabricated steel construction building technique, seen in use during the erection of a large school in Britain. The film shows how the prefabricated structures can be quickly, yet securely, assempbled on the building sit, with minimum building cost. The film emphasizes that this method is being used extensively in a varied range of public buildings including office blocks and libraries.

results.title: On Sacred Ground
results.creator_credit: Robin Hughes, Oliver Howes, Film Australia and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Discusses the controversial question of Aboriginal land rights. Deals with the arguments to preserve sacred sites versus the Australian government’s agreements with mining companies. Concentrates on the situation at the Noonkanbah Station in Western Australia. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin Hughes, Oliver Howes, Film Australia and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia

results.title: On s'est trompe d'histoire d'amour = We Were Mistaken About a Love Story
results.brief_description:
Anne, a switchboard operator, is living with Pierre who works in the same insurance company. One day, the young woman discovers she is pregnant. Anne finds unrealistic to keep the child given their social situation, while Pierre is overjoyed at the thought of becoming a father.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Jean-Louis Bertucelli ; writers, Jean-Louis Bertucelli, Coline Serreau ; photography, Claude Agostini ; music, Catherine Lara.
Cast: Coline Serreau, Francis Perrin, Nicole Dubois, Gerard Cailleau, Jacques Rispal.
